page.title: 15Flora of the Grafham Area.
page.content: The{poorly drained open country}is dominated by Fleabane, Meadowsweet, Cowslip and Hairy Willow Herb. In the damper pockets Marsh bedstraw and Lesser Spearwort are to be found. In the partly cleared woodland it is heavily shaded and mainly grass grows but nettles, marsh thistle and Ragged Robin are also found. On the{roadside verges}typical plants are Lesser Knapweed, Cow Parsley, and Grass Vetchling. The more uncommon flora found in the area are Hemp Agrimony, Eyebright, Twayblade,Gromwell, Musk Mallow and Milkwort. {Hedges}in the area are made up of Hazel, Hawthorn, Elder, Bryony and Blackthorn with climbing Honeysuckle, Bramble and Dog Rose.One hedge in the area is calculated to be 800 years old.
